attributes.title: Blackbeard Steals, Exploits, and Sinks the Queen Anne - Ship Hits the Fan Podcast
attributes.caption: How to make history for chaos and profit.
attributes.description:
In 1717, a former slave ship was captured by the most dangerous man on the high seas. For the next 9 months she would be used to make history, chaos, and profit, before deliberately sinking at the hands of her captain Edward Teach, a man most people knew as Blackbeard. This is Queen Anne’s Revenge. 



Go to http://lectricebikes.com to learn more.



Follow us on social:

https://twitter.com/mc_lotta

https://twitter.com/handsomemaster2

attributes.display_title: S4:E1 - Blackbeard Steals, Exploits, and Sinks the Queen Anne - Ship Hits the Fan Podcast

attributes.title: Caligula's Party Barges - Ship Hits the Fan Podcast
attributes.caption: Uh-Ohs and Whoopsies... After Dark.
attributes.description:
In 1929, two ancient ships were discovered in Lake Nemi. These ships had technology and features believed to be impossible until modern day and even more shocking… they had once belonged to one of the most infamous emperors of Rome, Caligula.



Go to http://lectricebikes.com to learn more.

attributes.title: The SS Ohio Endures Hell Saving the Island of Malta - Ship Hits the Fan Podcast
attributes.caption: The SS Ohio Somehow Rescues the Island of Malta.
attributes.description:
August 3rd, 1942 the Island of Malta was trapped in the middle of the Mediterranean Ocean during one of the most brutal naval battles of World War 2. In desperate need of fuel, protection, and food, the Islanders had one hope to survive… the SS Ohio.

attributes.title: The Tragedy of the Taiping Refugee Steamer - Ship Hits the Fan Podcast
attributes.caption: 1500 refugees fend for themselves in open water.
attributes.description:
One freezing January night, in 1949, thousands of people fled China in search of a better life in Taiwan. Only hours later, under cover of darkness, the ship carrying them struck another vessel leaving more than 1500 passengers and crew to fend for themselves in open water. 



Follow us on social:

https://twitter.com/mc_lotta

https://twitter.com/handsomemaster2

attributes.title: Enslaved People Seize Their Ship and Their Freedom - Ship Hits the Fan Podcast
attributes.caption: Enslaved people free themselves.
attributes.description:
In the fall of 1841, 135 enslaved people were loaded onto a boat bound for the slave markets of New Orleans. The boat would never reach its destination, but rather its passengers would take control of the ship and reach the Bahamas and freedom. 



Follow us on social:

https://twitter.com/mc_lotta

https://twitter.com/handsomemaster2

attributes.title: Negligence and Fraud Sink the Sewol Ferry - Ship Hits the Fan Podcast
attributes.caption: A simple ferry ride turns deadly.
attributes.description:
Early in the morning on April 16, 2014 a ferry carrying 476 passengers from Incheon to Jeju attempted a tight turn and capsized. The crew abandoned the vessel and the passengers, and within hours the sea had claimed over 300 lives. 



Go to http://lectricebikes.com to get out there and find adventure!

attributes.title: Kamikaze Pilots Sink the Bismarck Sea - Ship Hits the Fan Podcast
attributes.caption: The last U.S. aircraft carrier to be sunk by enemy action.
attributes.description:
February 21st 1944, as the sun set on the invasion of Iwo Jima, a squadron of Japanese pilots approached on the horizon. By morning over 40 planes were lost, and the last US aircraft carrier to be sunk by enemy action lay at the bottom of the sea. 



Follow us on social:

https://twitter.com/mc_lotta

https://twitter.com/handsomemaster2

attributes.title: The USS Greeneville Impresses Some VIPs, Sinks the Ehime Maru - Ship Hits the Fan Podcast
attributes.caption: Nuclear Sub VS Fishing Boat.
attributes.description:
February 9th, 2001, the Ehime Maru set out from Honolulu on an educational fishing expedition, a few miles away the USS Greeneville set out from Pearl Harbor on a trip to impress investors. Hours later… the Ehime Maru would lie at the ocean floor and some of its passengers would never be seen again.



Follow us on social:

https://twitter.com/mc_lotta

https://twitter.com/handsomemaster2

attributes.title: Digging Up the Lost Treasures of the Arabia - Ship Hits the Fan Podcast
attributes.caption: What secrets lay beneath the Missouri River?
attributes.description:
September 5th, 1856, the Arabia was making a routine trip up the Missouri river. After hitting a submerged portion of a tree, the ship sank below the mud of the river within minutes, taking all of its cargo with it. 150 years later a crew unearthed her cargo, and her secrets.



Follow us on social:

https://twitter.com/mc_lotta

https://twitter.com/handsomemaster2

attributes.display_title: S4:E9 - Digging Up the Lost Treasures of the Arabia - Ship Hits the Fan Podcast

attributes.title: A Forgotten Cargo Ship Destroys Half of Beirut - Ship Hits the Fan Podcast
attributes.caption: Fireworks and ammonium nitrate are a bad combo.
attributes.description:
2013, an old cargo ship makes port in Beirut, Lebanon. Unable to pay for port fees and repairs, the ships’ cargo is placed in a warehouse where it sits forgotten for 7 years, until a fire changes the course of Lebanon’s history.



Go to http://lectricebikes.com to learn about the XPedition cargo eBike.

attributes.title: The Aotaka and the SS Kiangya Explosion - Ship Hits the Fan Podcast
attributes.caption: Unexploded mines come back to haunt us.
attributes.description:
In the midst of World War 2, one of Japan’s only minelaying ships sets a series of explosives off the coast of China. The mines remain untouched for nearly a decade, until a steamship fleeing the Chinese Civil War sails directly into their path, killing almost everyone on board.

attributes.title: The Great Lakes Were No Match for The Big Blow - Ship Hits the Fan Podcast
attributes.caption: Over 30 ships damaged or destroyed.
attributes.description:
November, 1913. One of the deadliest storms in history sweeps through the Great Lakes. In her wake some ships are badly damaged, some are destroyed, and some are never seen again.

attributes.title: What Sunk the Floating Crypto Bro Utopia? - Ship Hits the Fan Podcast
attributes.caption: A crypto utopia on the high seas.
attributes.description:
A group of cryptocurrency moguls had a dream, a dream of creating a crypto-utopia on the high seas, but poor planning and maritime law would cause their dream to crash harder than their portfolios.
